titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale University Library Records Concerning Renovation Projects
Yale University Library Records Concerning Renovation Projects
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday April 6, 2019 at 07:01

did.unittitle: Yale University Library records concerning renovation projects

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of assessments, plans, estimates, summaries, pictorial records, and architectural plans documenting the renovation of Sterling Memorial Library at Yale.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 46-B (YRG 46-B), Records and materials documenting individual Yale buildings, facilities, and grounds.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is partially restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Architectural drawings transferred to Record Unit 1, Architectural drawings and maps of Yale University buildings and grounds, Series II, boxes 732-740.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale University Library Records Concerning Renovation Projects (RU 801). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of assessments, plans, estimates, summaries, and pictorial records documenting the renovation of Sterling Memorial Library at Yale.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.
